posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked:
I need some help. When I deploy the code, I keep getting a error:

I’m confused because I only initialize one motor with this CAN ID in my code, and I checked my code and I made sure I only initialized one motor. I tried changing the motor ID to a different number but it still gave me the same error for some reason.

posts.name: Jainish Patel
posts.cooked: Check REV Client if there are two devices on the same ID.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You’re creating two instances with the same ID.  The second one is in Arm.Java.  You’re either instantiating Arm twice or you have somewhere else in your code using the same id.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: I checked and each id is only associated with one motor

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Ok, I figured it out, it turns out I created of the arm class which probably initialize two of each motor in the class. THanks

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Yeah, you have an Arm object in both Robot.java and RobotContainer.java.  That would definitely do it.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
